_inspectorSnowReport.Report: The snow tap is on! Another storm has arrived, dropping off 9 inches of new snow overnight with another few inches forecast while lifts are spinning today. Weve received over four feet of snow in the last week, greatly improving conditions and allowing us to open most of our frontside terrain. The skiing and riding should be great today, with cold temperatures keeping the snow light and fluffy. Summit Express opened for the season yesterday, providing access to multiple trails, including Dynamite and Headwall Forest. We hope to have Summit spinning again today following avalanche mitigation work this morning. Expect some delays on lifts and terrain this morning as mitigation work takes place. To reach Summit you must take the Sunrise chairlift there is currently no access from the top of Apex Express. Keep your eyes peeled for unmarked hazards, especially in the trees, and stay out of closed terrain. Ducking ropes into closed terrain will cost you your pass for 30 days at all Ikon Pass resorts. Enjoy the new snow and have a thrilling Thursday at Solitude!

_inspectorSnowReport.Alert: 9 inches of new snow since lifts closed. Know The Code, limit your speed, and stay in control while skiing and riding.
